Even my 10 yo brother thought the movie was stupid and immature. It literally made me never want to watch a movie again. Whatever you do stay away from this movie at all costs. Jessica Alba is also one of my favorite celebrities. I cant believe she actually agreed to be in a movie like this. I didn't listen to what people said about it and watched it anyway. That's the last time i do that.

As one who has always enjoyed Mike Myers work, I decided to rent The Love Guru this week.About 30 minutes into the film, my girlfriend said, "I don't understand how they can get the money together to make a movie THIS bad. Didn't anyone read the script?" She left the room shortly after.I asked her to turn it off when she left.To say this is a bad movie is an understatement. I didn't laugh once, and I really wasn't even amused. It was quite painful to watch. After 45 minutes it was evident that the story was already laid out and there was no point to continue watching as you already knew what was going to happen. Considering there was no humor up to this point, I was pretty certain that I was not going to laugh. It needed to die. The characters were petty, shallow, and not funny. The sight gags were not funny. The writing was not funny. It was a travesty. I am really disappointed in this film.Even though it was a rental, I am going to ask for my money back. The studio should not benefit for putting out such drivel.

Recap: Guru Pitka is frustrated that ever being in the shadow of Deepak Chopra. But when the owner of the Toronto Maple Leafs seeks his advice Pitka sees his chance. If Guru Pitka can reunite their biggest star with his estranged wife, and break the Leafs' curse and win the Stanley Cup, none less than Oprah herself has offered him a spot on her show.Comments: Supposedly a cut character from the Austin Powers' movies, and it shows. The humor and set up are identical to the Austin movies. Unfortunately that means that most of the jokes are extremely low and juvenile. At best they are just about sex and mildly distasteful. At worst they are almost disgraceful and embarrassing for any above the age of five. It's a shame because Myers can be a good comedian at times, as is evident because a few jokes and puns are actually very good.Mostly it is a movie that should be forgotten as soon as possible. It should only be watched as a last resort and only if you're really tired and easily entertained. Because when you think about it, it is quite bad.3/10

For a comedy, then "The Love Guru" is surprisingly devoid of laughs and genuinely funny situations. Compared to previous Mike Myers movies, then this was a rather stale installment in his filmography.The story is about guru Pitka (played by Mike Myers) who travels to USA in order to settle a romantic issue between Darren Roanoaks (played by Romany Mallo) and his girlfriend Prudence (played by Meagan Good). Without their love-life in alignment Darren is unable to play well in the hockey matches.The laughs were scarce and far apart. I actually think that I laughed only a single time, and it was when Verne Troyer was defibrilated and was sent gliding along the ice arena.While lacking laughs, then the movie was rich on colorful characters who were portrayed by an impressively array of acting talents. Most memorable in the entire movie was the guru Tugginmypudha played by Ben Kingsley."The Love Guru" is not a memorable movie, and not one of Myers best moments. The movie is suitable for a viewing once or twice, but doesn't really holds enough contents to support multiple viewings.I had expected more of a comedy from this movie. Especially with the impressive cast ensemble. Sadly, the movie turned out to be less than mediocre.Oh, and before I forget; the best part of "The Love Guru" was the fact that they used Mariska Hargitay as a blessing or something. That was just a stroke of genius. And even better was it when she actually showed up.

reviews.review_title: Not as terrible as I had suspected, but still a lousy, straight-faced excuse for a comedy
reviews.content: In Mike Myers' career as a comedian, he has had a lot of success, with "Saturday Night Live" sketches, the two Wayne's World movies, the Austin Powers trilogy, and the voice of the popular computer animated character, Shrek. However, there have also been low points in his career, most notably his starring role in the poor full-length adaptation of Dr. Seuss' "The Cat in the Hat", from 2003, and this 2008 flop, "The Love Guru". Unlike "The Cat in the Hat", Myers not only starred in this film, he was also a writer for it, just like he was with the Wayne's World and Austin Powers movies. Unlike the comedian's previous full-length writing efforts, this one isn't funny. I thought it would be worse, judging by how much criticism it had received, but like most people, I didn't laugh.Maurice Pitka was born in America but raised in India, in the village of Harenmahkeester. At the age of twelve, he was given a chastity belt by Guru Tugginmypudha, forced to wear it until he found love in himself. He is now a guru, still wearing the belt, and dreaming of being the #1 guru and appearing on the "The Oprah Winfrey Show". He is called over to Toronto, Ontario, Canada by widely despised Toronto Maple Leafs owner Jane Bullard, to help Darren Roanoke, one of the hockey team's players. Roanoke has been troubled since his wife, Prudence, left him for French Canadian Los Angeles Kings goalie Jacques Grandé, which has been affecting his performance. Guru Pitka's job is to help the Leafs player with his troubles so he will play hockey as well as he used to. He attempts to get Roanoke back with his wife and get the troubled Leafs player to stand up to his aggressive mother.Before I watched this comedy flop, I knew it was widely abhorred for its immature potty humour. While the lame gross-out humour isn't as extreme or consistent as I expected, you can be sure it's still there. There's more than one booger joke, plus excretion gags, such as an elephant defecating, the flashback with the "stink mop" (a mop soaked in urine) used for fight training, and Guru Pitka making diarrhea noises. In addition to the bathroom jokes, there are also very juvenile sex jokes, including elephant sex on the hockey rink! In addition to the crude physical gags, there are also verbal ones, which also happen to be weak. Many modern comedies show that sex and toilet humour can really be funny, but "The Love Guru" is one of many other modern comedies that show this kind of humour can also be really lame. Not only is Myers not funny in this movie, neither is Stephen Colbert as sex-crazed stoner hockey announcer Jay Kell, or anyone else in the cast who may try to be funny. After seeing the film, I'm also convinced that pop sensation Justin Timberlake, who plays Jacques Grandé here, can't act, which doesn't help the fact that I don't respect him as a singer, either.All the hatred for this movie made me think that maybe Mike Myers had sunk to the level of Tom Green, another comedian from my country, but a much less talented one. Fortunately, it turns out he hasn't, but he's still going to have to come up with something funnier than this if he wants to recover his career. While watching "The Love Guru", I didn't laugh at all, and don't think I even smiled, even if there were parts where I came close, whether that was a good thing or not. I guess it takes a lot for a movie to REALLY disgust me, but I think I've made it clear that I'm still not impressed with this particular comedy. I'm not sure if it was worthy of beating "Meet the Spartans" and "Disaster Movie" at the Razzies (I haven't seen either of those films, but seeing Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer's previous project, "Epic Movie", was enough to tell me that the duo just might know the definition of unfunny better than anyone else in the history of comedy), but coming from a comedian who has talent, I'm sure this film has come as a shock to many people! If you love puerile adolescent humour, then maybe this film is for you. If not, then I suggest you skip it.

If you thought Mike Myers was being given too much creative control on those latter two 'Austin Powers' films you haven't seen anything yet.This whole film is a massive vanity project for Myers, and perhaps he needed a firmer director to say that perhaps not everything here was comic gold.But it remains entertaining enough, in the sort of comic style that Myers has that you'll either love or hate.If 'Austin Powers' was his attempt at mimicking Peter Sellers' 'Pink Panther' Inspector Clouseau then this is most certainly his attempt at doing the same with 'The Party'.Overall, a very hit and miss affair.

This film is in the same vein as the Austin Powers films. It's campy, it's fun, it doesn't take itself seriously. If you're looking at reviews to see if you'd like the film, just know that if you liked any of Meyers previous films, you'll probably like this. It doesn't deserve a fraction of hate it's getting from the wannabe critics and edge lords.

reviews.review_title: A funny movie, unless you are expecting Austin Powers
reviews.content: After reading many of the reviews that kept bashing the movie, saying it was the worst movie he had ever starred in - I would rather say Shrek the Third, but hey, let the elitist film reviewers say what they want.I found myself skipping back a few seconds a lot, because some of the most hilarious jokes where hard to hear.It also had a great moral value, just like the Americans like.Bah, Who's reading this anyway? I liked the movie, yet I am not a stupid person, as some of the reviewers would like to think, due to my love for feelgood-comedies, with no big underlying propaganda.

I've never understood why comedy doesn't get the big ratings that drama does. Sure this is silly. There's too many d$$k jokes but nevertheless it's easily one of the funniest comedies made in the 2000s. The satire on the self help craze is spot on. Not to mention some wonderful takes on Bollywood Music Videos.. Oh yes and both Jessica Alba and Justine Timberlake show excellent comedic talent along side the amazing Mike Myers.

The Love Guru (2008): Dir: Marco Schnabel / Cast: Mike Myers, Jessica Alba, Justin Timberlake, Ben Kingsley, Verne Troyer: Title speaks for itself as famous Guru Pitka is summoned from India to Canada to reunite a fallen hockey player with his ex-girlfriend. Not a bad setup but from there it is pretty straight forward. The outcome isn't surprising since it becomes rather pointless for Pitka when his goal is met with attitude shifted, but director Marco Schnabel is backed with colourful production that makes a good distraction from the shabby writing. Mike Myers has fun as Pitka whom often remembers his training and his yearning to get a spot on Oprah. Jessica Alba as the woman whom summoned him is basically eye candy. Justin Timberlake as a rival goalie is underused. He is screwing the hockey player's girlfriend and being a total jerk about it. Is it possible that he will meet his match when Pitka is done with his rival? Does this movie suck? Ben Kingsley steals scenes as the cross-eyed Guru trainer but the role is totally one-note. Verne Troyer work well with Myers as Mini-Mi in the Austin Powers films but here the magic is lost. Here is an example of an idea that might have worked since the concept wasn't bad, but it gets reduced to crude jokes and toilet humour worthy of a quick trip to the trash can. Satire of talk show or self help figures but unfortunately only big Myers fans will love this Guru. Score: 5 ½ / 10

reviews.review_title: I will punch you in the shirt......
reviews.content: Born in America, but raised in Havemahkeeta in India, with a population of 76, Maurice had always to better Deepak Chopra, and be sexually active, ever since he was 12.His Guru, Tugginmypudha, while approving of Deepak, cautions Maurice and has a chastity belt put around his waist.Years later, Maurice has established himself as Guru Pitka in America, but would like to appear on the Oprah Show.Jane Bullard from the the Toronto Maple Leafs hires him to counsel their star hockey player, Darren Roanoke, to win back his wife, Prudence, from Kings' star player, Jacques Grande, and also stand up to his dominating mother, Lilian, he agrees to do so - whivh would mean a prime slot on Oprah....I can understand why people hate this film so much, on first viewing it does raise titter or two, but nothing as groundbreaking as Wayne or Powers.Andthis is where the problem lies. It's been years since we saw Myers on the screen, Not counting TCITH, it was Goldmember, and that formula was very tired by then.So people wanted something fresh, they got this, featuring Mini me, which would get people instantly comparing this to TSWSM, which was never a good idea.It does have it's charm though, and while some of the more visual gags don't work, a lot of the films connotations and innuendo are laugh out loud funny.It never gets dull, over the top silly at times yes, but never dull. All the cast are fine, especially Alba and Timberlake, but this is Myers baby, and it shows, it obviously made him laugh on paper, but but it doesn't always ring true here.Otherwise, it's nowhere near as bad as the critics or box office said, it's actually quite endearing.

reviews.review_title: Shouldn't we have Pro, Semi-Pro, and Amateur categories?
reviews.content: Movies like TLG make me wish that we could rate movies on different scales, similar to Pro, Semi-Pro, and Amateur sports teams. (I think we could sneak a Schoolboy category in as well.) If we rated TLG in the Pro category, which I believe to be appropriate, it would get one star (or zero stars, if we were permitted to do so.) It is THAT bad and that much of a disappointment coming from Mike Myers. If, on the other hand, we ranked it in the Amateur category, it probably deserves five or six stars.But we can't do this. The only reason that I give TLG three stars is that there ARE much worse movies out there. But most of these have been made by dilettantes with cameras. TLG was a serious effort made with a serious budget.And I have to admit that I never really cared much for Myers, either in SNL or in any of his previous movies. (I'm one of the few people for whom Austin Powers does nothing.) But leaving that aside, TLG is just not funny and not even interesting.Not worth your time. Believe me.

I have been a big Mike Myers fan for a long time and I can officially say he peaked 10 years ago. Perhaps the mortgage melt down got to him and he needed to raise some scratch. It was forced comedy and really the whole story was just awful. It was so bad I actually asked for my money back and was denied because I was more than half way through the film. Here's a suggestion, they should have a warning flash in movies that alerts you when you are almost half way through a film. Everyone involved should feel ashamed for being part of this project. Mr Myers you owe me $14 for the movie, $6 for snacks, $6 for gas and 88 minutes of my life back. If anyone involved in this movie has ever received an Academy Award, you should return it.

Disappointment is the only word that comes to mind after painfully sitting through the latest installment of another "poop and pee are still funny at 40" movie. This movie was nearly unwatchable. For some unknown reason I actually stayed to see final insult to the audience and Hockey fans alike: Elephant sex during Game 7 of the Stanley Cup Finals?!? This feature was no more than a healthy slab of recycled puns with penis and poop jokes serving as the bread on this giant turd sandwich.Basically, it is yet another accented Myers' character who is overly horny and obsessed with feces and flatulence (how original). He then spends little time with the "plot" of the movie;which seemed to involve reuniting a hockey player and his estranged wife, the Stanley Cup, and an appearance on Oprah in order to become the #1 Guru. The missing plot was replaced with jokes about penises large and small and you guessed it folks: MIDGETS! Again, how original. To put the cherry on top, we are treated to the aforementioned on-ice pachyderm plowing prior to a potential Stanley Cup clinching penalty shot. Good thing I got a matinée price to see this waste of celluloid.
Made me laugh a bit, not the best from Mike Myers but certainly not the worst.

Granted this movie isn't Myers best work but it was still funny and entertaining to watch. Myers has done some great work over the years and this is probably one of his worse. The jokes were a little lame, as was the writing but what can we expect from this type of comedy? The bad reviews here are a little over-reacted. The Coq fight was one of the highlights for me.Being from Quebec, Canada, I thought Justin Timberlake's performance was totally hilarious! His character was by far most entertaining. The "Quebec Pizza" had me laughing for days. Without Timberlake's performance, indeed this movie would of been a serious flop.

reviews.review_title: That was extremely painful to watch
reviews.content: That was extremely painful to watch. I can't describe my feeling in English or even in my native language. Watching this felt like giving a presentation for a hundred people while pooping and peeing in the same time and maintaing a creepy happy face.
Maybe for 1990-2000 that movie would be good (for 5-6/10) but now it's just not funny and very clique

reviews.review_title: So awful it doesn't even deserve 1 star.
reviews.content: This has got to be the worst movie I have EVER seen. Well Meet the Spartans was pretty awful too...Anyways. I went with a large group, I had no desire to see this movie but I did anyways. Luckily I did not have to pay for it. This movie was horrible. I was so bored and disgusted by it that I resorted to listening my ipod. I don't think anybody else in the theater enjoyed this movie. I should have walked out but for some bizarre reason I didn't. Mike Myers acted stupid. There were many "poop" "fart" and "testicles" jokes which I find disturbing and many jokes referring to sex. A total guy movie that I don't even think guys would enjoy. It tried much too hard to be funny. I don't think I ever heard anyone laugh during this movie. It was awful. I wish I had that hour and a half back in my life. I could have done something useful.

reviews.review_title: Quite possibly the worse movie in 2008
reviews.content: Now I've seen my fair share of bad movies. Sometimes a bad movie is a "good" movie in that it's a half decent way to whittle away a weekend afternoon when you have nothing better to do. You know a movie that you don't have to think too hard about and that is designed to be watched whilst sinking a few beers and downing a bag of chips.But then comes along a movie like this with A-list type stars (at least B-movies your expectations are kind of set) that is simply robbing you of 1.5 hours of your weekend afternoon.Mike Myers and Jessica Alba - shame on you for picking such a pathetically scripted movie with almost no redeeming features. The jokes aren't funny it's just bad, real bad! Even if paid by some schmuck off the street to watch it, I'd suggest handing them the money back Thumbs Down!

This came out at roughly the same time as Meet the Spartans. What a double whammy that was. For a while I thought my brain would turn to gray slime. There's corny and there's corny. This was a 12 course meal with corn at every serving and with cardboard being the only other ingredient. It felt like Mike Myers had gone off into his own little Mike's World which bore little resemblance to what anyone else found funny. Maybe its too much to expect one man to keep churning out gems like AustinPowers and WW which were undoubtedly good and original. Love Guru. An attempt to satire the self help, new age, spiritual movement's big-hitters and money-makers. A good target maybe. Maybe not. It certainly didn't expand into a good movie. Being 6 years ago I thankfully don't remember much about it. I do remember my 13 year old son being as baffled as I was. Films like this actually get made? People get paid to do it? And they're experienced film makers, not High School students? Life isn't how we imagined it.

reviews.review_title: Mike Myers' vanity project crashes and burns in a laugh free squandering of his talents.
reviews.content: Years after losing his parents and being taken in by Hindu gurus, Guru Maurice Pitka (Mike Myers), now known as The Love Guru, is now a successful self help mentor operating out of his Ashram in Hollywood. Pitka is approached by Toronto Maple Leafs owner Jane Bullard (Jessica Alba) whose star player Darren Roanoke (Romany Malco) has lost all confidence in himself after leaving his wife Prudence (Meagan Good) to sleep around with models only for Prudence to end up with Jacques "Le Coq" Grandé (Justin Timberlake) known for his well endowed manhood. Pitka immediately accepts the task with his publicist Dick Pants (John Oliver) informing him the success will be enough to get him an appearance on Oprah and overtake his rival Deepak Chopra (himself) and move from #2 Guru to #1.The Love Guru was a major passion project for Mike Myers. Spawned from coping with the loss of his father to Alzheimer's in the early 90s, Myers eventually found solace in the writings of Deepak Chopra and eventually struck up a friendship the two still maintain as well as creating a rough version of what would become Guru Pitka. The Love Guru was Myers first time headlining a live-action feature film since 2003's critical and commercial flop The Cat in the Hat, and due to Myers' behavior, which had been charitably describe as "Prima Donna", Myers filmography was rather quiet save for his Shrek contributions in the intervening years between Cat and Guru. In an interview with Colider prior to the film's release, Myers hoped to use the film's farcical nature as a way of conveying some of the teachings and wisdoms he himself had taken from Chopra, but upon release the film became the subject of critical derision and a massive financial flop recouping only $40 million of its $62 million budget. The film remains a black mark on Myers filmography and he hasn't headlined a film since only going for more Shrek voiceovers and supporting character work in films such as Inglorious Basterds, Bohemian Rhapsody, and a few documentaries. While Myers still enjoys fond reminiscence for his work in Wayne's World, Austin Powers, and Shrek, The Love Guru has definitely not endured itself like Myers other work.The character of Guru Maurice Pitka is just awful, while supposedly a guru who helps people get in touch with their "best selves", he's immature, lives an extravagant lifestyle, makes derogatory statements about homosexuals and little people, and has a really creepy leering approach to women that's frankly rather off putting. Pitka also often laughs and claps at his own jokes (much the same way Myers did in Cat in the Hat) and this approach is annoying because it smothers the few decent gags in the film that raise a snicker, only for the gags to be brought back again, and again, and again to diminishing returns to the point it makes you resent the initially gag. And when the movie isn't beating its few "okay, kinda clever" jokes to death with a blunt instrument, it goes for low aiming gags related to Little Person Maple Leafs coach Punch Cherkov as played by Verne Troyer who is basically forced to recycle most of the Mini Me gags from Austin Powers, multiple instances of hackneyed gross out and penis references, and trying to copy the humorous cameos from the Austin Powers films without actually having the cameos needed so we have the likes of late era Val Kilmer and Jessica Simpson while larger scale celebrity's who most likely said no such as Morgan Freeman, Tom Cruise, Katie Holmes, and Oprah are represented through either poor photoshops or so-so voice impersonators.The rest of the characters aren't that great either. Jessica Alba's still playing the underwritten overly sexualized love interest (down to the fact the gag of a lesbian experience is taken from a similar role she had in the Dane Cook vehicle Good Luck Chuck), Romany Malco's Darren is a womanizing poser who is now feeling emasculated because the wife whom HE divorced is now with a man with a bigger penis, and Pitka's just a fame hungry attention junkie so there's no one to root for despite the movie wanting us to take some of the lessons of Guru Pitka seriously but when the characters are this unlikable and irritating the lessons on personal fulfillment are just suffocated.The Love Guru is the inevitable end result of when someone starts to buy into their own Halo effect and isn't told "no". While from interviews with Myers there was an attempt to try and make something of humorous and spiritual value, Myers has clearly gone full speed ahead without taking the time to ask for second opinions or refinement of the material leading to a reprehensible lead character and an obnoxious film that lingers on gags set ups way longer than it should and periodically brings them back for second or even third helpings. I don't want this to be the last film Myers headlines because Myers is a talented comedian and actor, but assuming he does try to stage a comeback he should probably have a co-writer or director on hand to tell him "no".

reviews.review_title: More like the sort-of-like-it-if-nothing-else-is-on guru. Am I right, people? Right? Yeah...
reviews.content: Perhaps the most unpretentious movie you will ever see. This comedy aspires to nothing but cheap, dumb gags and paint by number romance enlivened by a master-class comedic performance from Myers.It's pretty good for the Hotel room...It's not impressive but it has this curious talent of being rather charming since it doesn't look down on its viewers.

This movie is simply painful to watch. I always enjoyed Mike Myers, but this movie was probably one of the worst i've seen. First off, the story isn't funny. There's maybe a few jokes that are laughable, but the rest are simply not funny. On a positive note, Mike Myers singing "9 to 5" and "The Joker" was quite good. Then there was Justin Timberlake role, the thing that really made me hate this movie. His role as a french Canadian (from Quebec) was way too over exaggerated. Using the word "tabarnak" (a french swear word) in every single lines he says just doesn't make it funny. The only good thing in this movie is Jessica Alba. She at least had a decent role. Even Verne Troyer wasn't entertaining. Don't even bother rent it, way for it to play on TV.

reviews.review_title: C'mon. Y'all are a bunch of haters.
reviews.content: Everyone states that this movie ruined the career of Mike Myers, and maybe it actually did in reality, but that statement is enough to make you think that this film is trash. In actuality, it's funny.Plot- A love guru tries to reunite a hockey player with his wife before the hockey championship. And alot of goofy stuff happens. Nothing too insane but there are some funny Bollywood-esque dance scenes that come about randomly.Characters/Acting- Mike Myers is great as ever, Verne Troyer makes a return, Alba's always a nice touch, Timberlake is a spaz. Overall goofy but still far from intolerable.Writing- Honestly I remember alot of the acronyms the guru makes up, the piss mop scene, Kanye West randomly appearing as a hockey fan. It's very similar to Austin Powers in style, but those films are far much better.Quality- It's got funny music scenes, it's not poorly edited, I mean it's a good goofy comedy. I don't understand the hate. I'd say the movie Get Hard is a totally unfunny movie, in general as well as in comparison. Just an example.Overall it's a good goofy film, if you're willing to watch one. Seriously, don't listen to the hate.

reviews.review_title: It has the potential to be enjoyed.
reviews.content: I saw this movie, and I was expecting a very low budget production. It was what I expected. But if you watch it as a Mike Meyers movie, it is actually a very funny movie. There are plenty of people on here who keep saying things about the production value, lack of a script, forgettable characters, etc. I found none of this to be true, because I watch a movie to be entertained. I don't watch a movie to waste $9.00 and pick all the bad things out.The best part about The Love Guru is the Guru Pitka. A totally self-absorbed, childish Guru who only cares about becoming better than Deepak Chopra. Meyers delivers a great performance, always in perfect character, with the right emphasis on every situation. Alba shines as the beautiful Jane Bullard, just a decoration for the male audience to ogle. Verne Troyer is great as the perverted, agitated Coach Punch Cherkov. Justin Timberlake is absolutely spot on as Jacques "Le Coq" Grande, the well-endowed goalie for the L.A. Kings.The movie, as you will find out, is very touching. It is a good hearted (although somewhat filthy) movie, one that will remain one of my favorites.

What a beautiful parody and comedy in one piece. I enjoyed it a lot, Myke is just genius in crossing the fake stuff of real life into real stuff of the fake movies. That "TM" thing is just amazing ... And relations of sons with their mothers as well ... It is relaxing, fun giving and generally shining movie and I am going to watch it again and again. You can just sit into your chair, have some drink and watch the crowd of guru-hypnotized folks nodding on any stupid sentence giving to them approved by TM mantra ... I loved that.I noted though a lot of aversion in other comments against this movie - so what, you guys find your own guru Pitka, but you can hardly find more realistic one then Myke's.

reviews.review_title: Guru Pitka is a less likable version of Austin Powers.
reviews.content: Of all things about this mess of a movie, the most surprising to me was the character of Guru Pitka. I thought he would be a silly character, but one who cared about others. He was surprisingly more crude and horny than Austin Powers, and the character, and Mike Meyers himself, just couldn't stay away from the wiener jokes. I took a count on how many male genital jokes were in this film, and I came up with 39, which means every 2 minutes there was a genital joke, which shows how far Mike Meyers was stretching for a script.Guru Pitka (Mike Meyers) is a self help guru who focuses mainly on people's love lives, and gives stupid seminars in which he uses mnemonics for his multi-step programs that usually spell out dirty words. Pitka is living in the shadow of a rival guru Deepak Chopra, and more than anything, Pitka wants to get on Oprah so he can become a more respected guru. He tries to help a hockey player Darren Roanoke (Romany Malco), who's marriage is on the rocks, to get publicity. The manager of the team died a few years back and his daughter Jane (Jessica Alba) is running the team now. Pitka both falls for her and wants to help her self esteem. Bad jokes ensue.There are so many negatives to this film, and very few positives, but there are positives, and this isn't the worst movie I've ever seen. In fact, this isn't even the worst of the year. Meet the Spartans was worse, and this was a treat compared to that. But nonetheless, I'll start with the negatives here. The characters are just awful. As I've said, Pitka was very unlikable and acted like an annoying 12 year old. Justin Timberlake was obnoxious as a rival hockey player who was dating Darren's wife. Every joke based around him has to do with the size of his privates...funny, huh!? Verne Troyer aka Mini Me plays the Hockey Coach and he was better when he didn't talk much. Steven Colbert is seen throughout as a hockey announcer, and though he can be funny, he needs the right material to play off of, and this is not it. Ben Kingsley plays my favorite character, who's name is so long I don't want to spell it out. He plays Pitka's mentor is flashbacks back in India, and though he's not funny, Kingsley just has a presence that no one else in this sorry picture could even try to emulate. His character is pretty similar to Mike Meyers in View from the Top, so he's really not bringing much new to the table, unfortunately. We also are treated to some really random cameos, like Jessica Simpson, Kanye West, Mariska Hargitay and the very random Val Kilmer. What an eclectic group they have. The direction is okay, but it doesn't really matter, because it's the writing that does this one in. Mike Meyers wanted to play Austin Powers again I guess, so he created an Indian carnation of him that manages to be a lot less funny, more crude, and dare I say, a character that's even more sex starved.Onto the positives. There were a few moments where I laughed, and they were generally ones after long sustain periods of boredom, and the scenes caught me by surprise because they were mildly amusing. The acting isn't bad, the characters are, so the acting is a positive. I was mildly entertained at moments throughout, but overall this was just a horribly written mess that relied way too little on brain, and way too much on jokes about the male second brain. I found Pitka's appearance on the season finale of American idol funnier than anything in this movie.My rating: * out of ****. 85 mins. PG-13 for sexual humor, drug use and language

Now many reviews say how terrible this film is, honestly, I find that offensive. Sure, this is no classic, neither is it one to watch more than once, but it's definitely worth watching. Mike Meyers decides to take on a completely ridiculous role and the co-stars choose to do the same, who would have thought that Ben Kingsley would play the character he played in this film. It seems that the whole idea of silly humor has lost its popularity in the recent years, and films such as Airplane, Blazing Saddles, Robin Hood Men in Tights and other classic comedies are all being forgotten. I don't know about you but the comedies that are deemed funny today aren't particularly funny, just watchable, entertaining at most. The Love Guru is not a fantastic movie, but it's fun to watch and you could even see yourself quoting it every now and then. Don't let the rating fool you, if you have it, or want to watch something lighthearted, watch this film

reviews.review_title: While this movie isn't a 10/10 - it's memorable and enjoyable
reviews.content: The ratings people gave this movie are unacceptably fake. Giving it anything below a 6 is obvious virtue signaling.The cast is good. The sets are well made. The actors do try to make it funny and succeed more often than not.It may have references, similar to Letterkenny, but it's not necessary to be canadian, merely having watched enough US cinema.WATCH IT if you didn't. Don't pay attention to the negative rating.

reviews.review_title: Even if you hate reading reviews, please take these seriously
reviews.content: I went into the theater with an open mind, as a friend claimed to have enjoyed this movie (that's the last time I take advice from him). After the first 10 minutes it become obvious that the entire movie would be nothing but massively overused, immature jokes that were never funny in the first place, along with very poorly written dialogue and the most predictable storyline since a cop eating a donut. There was not one moment throughout the entire film where I even chuckled once. The only people I would even consider recommending this film to are those with an IQ below 75 who have never once heard a joke in their life. Actually, no, I wouldn't even want them to suffer through it.

Love Guru was really weak. It was just terrible. The acting was okay, it had a lot of stars, but was just bad.It didn't really go through smoothly. It had plenty of rough edges. The main theme song was really cool though. But that's about it.3 stars

I think this movie is highly underrated, it was really okay. The cast was well picked and everyone did a good job at making their characters' believable. The storyline of Mike Meyers character "Guru Pitka" did not veer off from the movie's title at all. Mike Meyers may have used the same approach of delivering his jokes as in past movies, but that's his style. It's like Adam Sandler and Rob Schneider being in the same movie a bunch of times, you know you're in for a boat load of the same comedy. All comedians have their own way of telling jokes and audiences will take it in differently. Most of the jokes told in this movie are more for the "sick minded" and those who aren't, will have a hard time understanding them.

First... excuse me for English mistakes, it is not my language. Although this movie is looks like some another gag movie form Mike Myers, there are some hidden and profound messages in every joke of Guru Pitka. He is basically making you smile while giving you spiritual advice on how to live a happier life. I watched other Mike Myers movies and didn't find them so interesting but this is amazing! The more you see it, the more you will realize what advice he is giving to humanity... (I don't want to write spoilers so please see it yourself - instead of concentrating on jokes try to concentrate on what is he actually saying in his gags) I was really astonished to see that this movie is so low rated, in my opinion it is unbelievably underrated. Too bad, I would love to see continuation of this film.

I don't write many reviews. Actually I haven't wrote any. But every once in awhile I like to read the 10/10 reviews of my favorite movies. This one makes me laugh because of its especially low rating. People just don't get it, and if they most likely wont get it!Its just such a lovely picture! Myers is the man to go back to the roots of childhood and simply bring back innocence. Which is all too often sadly left behind and we strive to get towards bigger and better things in life. Pretty parodoxial I know right? To just be silly, but to grow at the same time. Life is a beautiful flower. Life is a roller coaster. Life is fun. So laugh at things worth laughing at. Its the best joy in life!Don't take it so seriously! Cheers to our innocence!Sincerely, -Shawn

reviews.review_title: More like the "The Hated Guru" then the "The Love Guru"
reviews.content: I like Mike Myers and i think he is a pretty funny actor. I remember i saw a trailer for this movie back in March and it look pretty funny. When the movie came out, i did not saw it because of the low reviews from the critics. I saw it today for free and i'm Gald i saw it for free because this movie was just pain awful. The movie had one or two funny jokes and the movie had very little story what so ever. The whole movie feel like a video on Youtube then a movie. The movie is full of pointless fart jokes that are not funny at all. The casting was the only good thing about this movie! I think the trailer for this movie was funnier then the movie it self.Don't waster your time or money on this movie because nothing in this movie is worth checking out. If you want to see a good funny movie that came out at the moment then see Hancock!

reviews.review_title: needs a reboot with better script, actors and jokes
reviews.content: The idea of a guru that everybody ask for something in a comedy is fun, but this movie never works. Needs another comedy actor with a better script, real jokes and actors who play more instead of just look at the camera.

The Love Guru is definitely one of the worst comedies I have ever been unfortunate enough to watch. If you can call it a comedy. I wish Mike Myers would step up and explain why he chose to be in this movie, as he is a funny actor and has proved this in other films. None of the obviously set up lines in this movie are remotely funny, nor are they creative. Most of them are repeats of earlier lines said at the beginning of the film, just worded differently. The acting is mediocre at best, although it is most likely worsened by the horrible script. I also believe that the plot was set up for the wrong reasons. Although Mike Myers was born in Toronto, the movie focuses much too obviously on Canada, and it seems to attempt to get a good feeling of pride out of the viewer, be it the Toronto Maple Leafs being the focus of the movie or Jessica Alba's lines displaying her pride of being Canadian. Instead it just made the movie seem even more pretentious. Overall The Love Guru was a terrible film that I wish could return the wasted time I spent watching it.

reviews.review_title: why do you do it Mike Myers?
reviews.content: Wow this movie is uniquely bad, you know the kind where there are so many little things that annoy you that you don't even know where to begin.Anyways let's just start with Myers, he is so very annoying and unlikable that making friends with a landmine would be more fun. He isn't shy about trying every racist joke and stereotype about Indians. His humor is that of a 5 year old with many many fart and punching someone in the nuts jokes. The advice he gives is shallow and the whole trademark thing makes no sense. He needs someone who can support his kind of comedy, which in this film can not be done by Alba or Romany Malco(the hokey player with love problems) and neither is Myers expressive enough to make the whole chewed through story work.The rest of the cast is forgetful at best and fills you with rage at worst(WTF Ben Kingsley) The story of course is the other part, not only is the script predictable, I also got the feeling as if they were trying to make fun of every minority in the flick and that in a painfully hateful and unfunny way. They make inappropriate jokes about little people, African American and to some extend even Canadian and none of it works.I recommend you watch it if you are looking deep into your wine bottle or just want a new reason to hate humanity.

I think the problem is not that the movie is "juvenile" or "self indulgent", but rather that so many of the reviewers here are! If you don't like comedy, then why the hell are you writing a review on a Mike Myers film? The point of "The Love Guru" is to make you laugh, not to win Academy Awards. If your goal in watching it is to laugh, then unless you have no sense of humo(u)r, you can't go wrong with the Love Guru. I was laughing so much I had to pause the DVD a few times -- it is absolutely hilarious, I found it much more consistently funny than any of the austin powers movies that all the amateur movie reviewers here probably fell over themselves trying to get to their iphones to type glowing reviews for. Furthermore, I'd say it's LESS self-indulgent and LESS potty humor oriented than austin powers (which isn't to say there isn't plenty of both -- there is - if you don't love scatological humor then why the hell would you watch Mike Myers??). The real problem is perhaps that it takes on "spiritual" subjects with hilarious results, which will perhaps hit people a bit too close to home...There are so many hilarious references to sports, to the "self improvement" world, to Indian culture, there is a lot to like here. I think the movie is a bit ahead of it's time, it will perhaps be better liked in 5 years than now. But don't be dissuaded by bad reviews from people that don't really enjoy comedy or possess an actual sense of humor -- check it out for yourself! But leave your ego at the door, and enjoy it for what it is.

reviews.review_title: Naughty, Silly, Stupid and Highly Underrated!
reviews.content: Mike Myers has done some very forgettable movies... Wayne's World II, The Cat in the Hat, the last 3 Shrek disasters... but this isn't one of them. If just for the sake of pure adult fun, this movie is a winner hands down. Is it high art? Definitely not. Is it laugh-out loud funny with crude humor, gross-out moments and millions of sight gags? Absolutely.It seems like people take movies so seriously these days that they forget how to watch a movie just for the fun of it. Granted, this movie will probably appeal more to men than women, but there's plenty of naughty chuckles for everyone. This movie is an odd, twisted conglomeration of Canadian Hockey and Eastern Mysticism, which is merely a loose framework on which Myers strings joke after joke, gag after gag, often taking the oldest jokes in the book and giving them new meaning and zing.I have hundreds of movies in my disc collection, and this is one of the very few that I can take out and watch over and over when I need a good laugh. I recommend taking a lazy afternoon to throw on this movie, particularly with a couple of good friends, pop open a beer and sit back for some extremely strange and goofy fun. You'll find yourself with plenty of quotable lines, unforgettable outrageous scenes and a smile on your face.WARNING: This movie is not for pucker-butts. If you're uptight and prissy, please stay far away from this film.

After I saw 'Don't Mess with the Zohan' I didn't think it could get any worse. Then I saw the Love Guru. It has been a downward spiral for 2 of the funniest guys to come out of SNL. I had to give this movie a chance and I can honestly say that it was one of the worst decisions of my life. The terrible jokes, whether it was sexual or whatever, kept being overused and it just got to the point where it was annoying. I was lucky enough to sit in a movie theater with a bunch of 14 year olds and they could not stop laughing. Probably because they were 14 and very immature. I believe that Mike Myers' career is over. Since the last movies he has been in, Austin powers:goldmember, shrek, and the godawful Love guru, have completely bombed. It's hard to think that Myers has ever been funny. To sum up this movie I would have to say: it sucks, its the worst movie i've seen in a long time and if you haven't seen it yet, DON'T.

This movie is getting a severely bad wrap from people who just like to pile on and go with the masses. One if you don't like dick and fart jokes why did you pay 8 dollars to go see this movie. No wonder your angry and writing bad reviews. Boohoo you lost 8 bucks cause your to lazy to read a review. The humor in the movie is cheeky and sophomoric but that is part of what makes the movie so fun. This is a perfect relax movie, sit back and watch bad jokes and a contrived story. If you are going into this movie looking for smart humor from movies like clerks or the Austin powers series you wont find it. You will see some funny jokes, and some not, some good songs sung poorly with over the top dancing ala Austin Powers. If you aim low you will likely give this movie a 7 or above but if you are expecting another super bad Austin powers or even Napoleon dynamite you will likely give this a 3 or worse.

reviews.review_title: This movie taught me not to trust reviews!
reviews.content: I really enjoyed all of Mike Myers's movies, so I couldn't understand why 'The Love Guru' supposedly was so bad. I really expected a horrible movie because of all the reviews I've read, which were ALL negative. There was not one positive or even a neutral review, they were all very, very brutal and i felt like the reviewers just didn't give the movie a chance... I could kind of understand what the reviewers meant, but i didn't expect it not to be funny so I had to see it for myself.I was very bored and so I just gave it a shot; didn't expect to watch more than half of it. I wanted to give it a chance but actually had lost all hope. But I watched all of it, and loved all of it. I watched it on my own and really laughed out loud. It was joke after joke and they were all so corny.What I like of Mike Myers is how he doesn't take himself too serious, I mean he doesn't take himself serious at all!! A lot of people just don't appreciate that kind of humour, but I know a lot do. Maybe the movie was seen by the wrong target audience. This movie really is for people who can enjoy toilet humour, giggles and awkward situations.If you enjoy this, you should definitely watch this movie or even give it a second chance.

reviews.review_title: what made Meyers think it would be funny the tenth or fifteenth?
reviews.content: Even if you can put aside the annoyingness of the Guru Pitka, the movie still fails to deliver anything remotely funny. The most common joke is to have a characters name resemble something vulgar, such as "Dick Pants" or some other Grade 3 level joke. The next most common is the Guru's constant repeating of "TM" after one of his catchphrases. It wasn't funny the first time, what made Meyers think it would be funny the tenth or fifteenth? There's also the repetition of jokes from Austin Powers, ranging from the plane to even the casting of Verne Troyer, the midget who made one of his only popular appearances in the Powers films as Mini-Me. Finally, there are the gags that are just plain lame. These involve elephants humping each other, the Guru wearing a chastity belt, the Guru having a battle using mops soaked in urine, the Guru sticking his head up his own ass (which is actually far less funny than it sounds), the Guru getting punched in the groin, the Guru doing battle with a rooster and the Guru engaging in two very long song and dance numbers on the Sitar, one a rendition of Dolly Parton's "9 to 5", the other a ear-splitting variation on "Space Cowboy" by Steve Miller Band. Both are in there for no particular reason whatsoever (and I really do hope it wasn't for laughs).The other actors are fairly bad, although they really don't have much to work with. Jessica Alba continues her tradition of playing practically the same exact character, giggling and acting ditsy. Justin Timberlake is atrocious as Jacque Grande, although to be fair, his character was a one-note joke about Quebecois people. I'm bemused that Meyers would think Americans would find a joke about a people they likely know little about funny, especially when I didn't find it funny and I'm a Canadian. Verne Troyer just proves that the only reason he has even a semblance of a career is because of the novelty that he's a midget.

reviews.review_title: People take Spiritualism Way too Seriously
reviews.content:
This was a clever and funny movie. Not only did it have the lovely Jessica Alba, but as a Mike Meyers movie, we were regaled with a hearty cast of well known performers and actors from all the place.
Learning alot about religions from throughout the world and history, and the spiritual paths that many people have chosen in life have given me an edge at the way one looks at life. And this movie gets it. Aside form the fact that it obviously pokes fun at how many people get grifted by televangelists and new age gurus the world over, it also tries to redeem the hearts of people to not lose sight of whatever might be most important to them. One does not need to follow the doctrine or life of another unless they want to risk losing themselves to obscurity and sorrow. But sometimes, because of how brainwashed and vapid modern people are, the point has to be gotten across with some quasi "childish" or, dare I say, youthful humor. Hey look at the lil birdy humanity... thats right, smile for the camera and get over yourselves. Have a better one kiddies. And remember to laugh and live.

i cant believe the negative comments I'm seeing about this movie. people just don't have a sense of humor or have something against mike myers, Canadians or the Toronto Maple Leafs.i would rate this movie a 7.5 but since people don't know how to critic movies i gave it a 10. i don't know what people are expecting from these movies.Jacque" Le coq" Grande like //////cammonn!!!! funny stuff..Timberlake plays an excellent french Canadian hockey player.2 thumbs up for him. I kinda feel sorry about all the losers out there that didn't laugh to this movie.they must have serious issues. i cant wait for more work to come from mike myers.boyeeeeeeeeeeeeeee

I really don't understand why people don't think this film is funny. I laugh more or less constantly. Yes, 80% of the jokes are below the waist. So what?!? I'm a grown man who's not afraid of my inner child, and I think a town names Harinmakeesta is hilarious. I think the ball gazing trick is great fun. I think Timberlake is great fun as the goaltender who's hung like a horse. I think the guru's book titles are incredibly funny.
Nothing good can be said of this film. It is pure trash, without any redeeming qualities.

reviews.review_title: Not the best but heart was in the right place
reviews.content: This movie I feel gets an unfair amount of hate directed at it. I'm going to start by saying this; is it the greatest comedy movie ever? Is is superior to Myers' Austin Powers franchise? No not by a long shot. Is it funny? Are there some good jokes that make you laugh or even just chuckle at? Yes. OK so Mike Myers plays Guru Maurice Pitka, the titular Love Guru, who is tired of being second best to Deepak Chopra but opportunity arises when he is approached to save the marriage of Toronto Maple Leafs hockey player Darren Roanoke and possibly get one up on Chopra. While helping Darren, Pitka learns the important age- old lesson of being himself instead of trying to be someone else. The film also stars Jessica Alba, Justin Timberlake, Ben Kingsley and Verne Troyer with cameos from various celebrities. I first saw this movie after watching the Austin Powers movies from a mate who said this was another comedy from Mike Myers. He loaned it to me and I really enjoyed it, I thought it was very funny two of my favourite moments come from the meeting in Coach Cherkov's (Verne Troyer) office and when Pitka tells Darren he can fight anyone for any reason then proceeding to muck around with Cherkov. It's only in the past couple years I learnt that it didn't go down well with others. Of course I defend it. As I already stated it's by no means the best comedy movie ever but it's enjoyable nonetheless. The only thing that brings it down for me is the fact kanye west appears in it, granted it's a small cameo but still he's a sight I'm sure no-one wanted to see in the movie. Ideally when watching this movie you'll want to ignore what others have said about it and just not think too much, you'll find some of the jokes offensive granted and think "wtf!?" with some moments but the rest you'll smirk, chuckle and even full on laugh at

This movie is atrocious. It's boring. It's not funny. It's barely mildly entertaining. I did however get one thing out of this movie. I had the realization that Justin Timberlake is truly an underrated comedic bit actor #jt4lyfe.

Well, this movie is not soooo bad, as the most devastating critics said. It's a comedy OK. Not worse than zohan or yes man. You know, you have to watch this movie on a 3d degree level. I am sure that the subject, treating disrespectfully hinduism tru their gurus, can create a tsunami in these so called good consciences of stincky followers. But let me tell you that's good. You never heard a real guru. What myers do is just 0.5 percent of the fun or angriness ofa real guru. So don't be offended or laughing too much. I can feel this movie was calibrated, and they could have done much much more.. No guru should ever consider himself as important or useful. Yes, that seems contradictory to his so called job. But what is his job? Egoness, illusion and teaching of reality. We are here in a critic of famous TV gurus. Our Guru in the movie is so infatuated, he loves to receive attention, he loves to help others (what more egoistic than that) and he wants to be guru number one on oprah show. Then a woman and a coach contact him to help one of their player gain confidence. And he will...I found this movie touching, funny, non serious. And scratching the As s of these so called gurus who take advantage of people and their money, building vast usless ashrams or castles. There is rhythm in the movie and good ending. I left with a smile and wrote a letter to my parents telling them I love them. If it's not a proof. Well I know nobody will never read this review and the movie is out for a long time now. But I do what I want, the rest is not your D business.

I enjoyed the film. But then I enjoy the type of juvenile humor that is Mike Myers. I'll admit there were a couple of jokes that were overplayed, the acronym and book title jokes did get a bit stale. But overall it was fun, the midget managers office complete with midget furniture, the fake heart attack followed by defibrillator application scene, the killer guard cock, all good.Conservative types or people who just won't allow themselves to enjoy the moment probably won't like it. Joke 'em if they can't take a f*ck! Anyway I thought it was worth the price of admission. As with most Mike Myers films, I do think the film contains relevant valid social commentary.

I can only give three points to the cinematographer and actors who put in the misguided time to make this poorly written and rather racist/stereotyped film. Mike Myers is a funny guy, it's a shame he didn't devote his time to making a more tasteful representation of a "Guru" and giving more credit to Indian culture.Worse than that, it's genuinely not a funny movie. I had a few moments of maybe "chuckling in my head" but those moments were few and far between in this train wreck of a film. I like the direction Mike has gone with his career, doing more dramatic roles. This was probably a dark spot in his career.

Mike Myers is at the bottom of the list of the probably 50 comedians I find truly funny. Eternally stuck in prepubescent boy humor. I watched maybe 20 minutes of the 1st Austin Powers movie and walked out. That being said, I had the TV on while doing housework and this came on after something I was half watching, and I hate to admit that I actually found some of this stupid movie funny. Go figure. I'll never watch it again, but I didn't hate it. Not totally. Ehh.

reviews.review_title: Love and Comedy, I think not.
reviews.content: The Love Guru (2008) *1/2I enjoy Mike Myers' work very much. He has been more or less consistently funny throughout his career. Wayne's World and the Austin Powers films are noteworthy comedy classics. He's mastered the fine line between clever stupidity and just outright stupidity - or so you would have thought by now.The Love Guru is almost devoid of any cleverness. Jokes fall flat, and I sadly rarely laughed. Even sadder, I rarely even grinned. The Love Guru may well be a terrible film, but I didn't hate it by any stretch. I was just supremely disappointed. I had low expectations to begin with, so maybe that is why I didn't hate it.Myers is the Guru Pitka, in a surprisingly unfunny turn. He's hired by Jane Bullard (Alba), the Toronto Maple Leafs owner, to recoup their star player, Darren Roanoake. His wife has run off with Jaques Le Grande (Timberlake), and he is distraught. Myers and Alba develop a baffling relationship, and he is on a quest to remove his chastity belt. That's about it for the plot.The jokes are crude, vulgar, and simply not funny most of the time. It's a bad sign when you have your characters laugh more at their jokes than the audience. Chuckles are far and few in between, and mostly come from supporting players. Timberlake has some good moments. His reference to Quebec Pizza had me in stitches, even in the previews. I suspect any other Canadians found this rather amusing, not because the Pizza in Quebec actually comes on poptarts, but because anyone who's ever eaten pizza in Quebec knows that it may as well. Stephen Colbert has a few moments as a commentator as well.Asides out of the way, the film tries to make some attempts at inside pokes and humor regarding the Leafs history (ie, the Ballard curse), but it spends most of its time making penis jokes, which literally come at least once every 5 minutes.I'm sure there is an immature and I assume young audience of teenage boys that will get a big kick out of the onslaught of lowbrow. There is nothing wrong with mindless comedy when its consistently funny, but The Love Guru just isn't. And that, I must confess, is sad for Myers et al.

What happened to Mike Myers????? This movie is just plain awful. I'm so glad I didn't pay to see it. Maybe Mike Myers needs to get out of the acting business. The dialog was awful, the acting was worse. I'm sorry I wasted 20 minutes of my life watching the beginning of it. What has happened to Hollywood? Movies are $10 now and the movies are just not quality movies anymore. I think Mike Myers should refund the money to people who DID pay to see this untalented piece of garbage. Don't see this movie! I saw this movie with a large group of people--and we all walked out of it. Those that paid to see it, demanded their money back. The manager was nice enough to refund some but not all.

It's the kind of movie you'll never watch again, but one where you'll remember some of the bits and recite.Justin Timberlake is great. There are a few funny bits, but most are dumb. The plot is thin and only watchable because of the amusing leads. If this flick stared unknowns it would be totally un-watchable.And now it's time to fill ten lines with the storyline: Pitka an American raised outside of his country by gurus, returns to the States in order to break into the self-help business. His first challenge: To settle the romantic troubles and subsequent professional skid of a star hockey player whose wife left him for a rival athlete.
Such a terrible film - I know it's already been said. But the level of racism even for its time is really astonishing. There went Meyers' career

Normally love Myers' work but he really dropped the ball on this one. Poorly executed, bad jokes, culturally insensitive. Better luck next time if his chance ever comes back (his career has gone down since)

Sorry Mike - I love your work but this film was beyond disrespectful and just ignorant. I think most people would not get offended but when you have a grasp of cultural sensitivity, you find it hard to laugh at such bad jokes.

reviews.review_title: This gets a 2/10 for one reason
reviews.content: I liked the "blowme" scene so I added a star... besides that I never really like Mike Myers a whole lot so this was just the movie that made me dislike him.This shouldn't be called, "The Love Guru" it should be called, "Unfunny penis jokes, by Mike Myers."You know that guy Marco Schnabel? Sounds familiar... oh its the guy that directed the movie!... well see yeah. Hope you had a nice career. *flushes toilet*Okay seriously, I didn't like Austin powers, I didn't really ever totally liked Mike Myers.... so its not like this movie wasn't a disappointment so I gave it another star so it would be above my other bad ratings...You see I dislike bad writers, like Mike Myers, who think they write good movies that are bad... THEN CONTINUOUSLY DO IT!M. Night Shyamalan is by far worse, so bad, I seriously gave "Birdemic" a better rating then Avatar the Last Airbender the movie...I'm doing the same with this movie, no disappointment, 1 funny joke, ehhhhhh 3/10

reviews.review_title: The sad thing about this film is that Mike Myers is desperately trying to be funny.
reviews.content: The Love guru is the latest comedy character created by Mike Myers. Myers was very successful with Austin Powers and this film is supposed to show that Myers can do more to make us laugh with new and original characters. Unfortunately for Myers his new character is not funny and the film he is placed in is very poor.The basic plot for the love guru. Guru Pitka (Myers) is the second best love guru in the world, but dreams of being the best, which to him means going on Opera. He gets an opportunity to make himself the best through Darren Roanoke (Romany Malco).He is a hockey player who has been of his game since his wife left him for another player called Jacques "Le Coq" Grandé (Justin Timberlake). The owner of the club, played by Jessica Alba wants the guru's help so he can help Darren Roanoke and make the team have a chance of winning the Stanley cup.Now the plot is poor and very predictable and I found myself seeing how long was left till this peace of rubbish ended. None of the acting is any good. Jessica Alba does a great job of looking good, but that is about it. Justin Timberlake puts on a stupid accent which is meant to be funny but is not. Vearn Troyer( a.k.a. Mini me) just spends the film shouting and swearing. Not even Myers supplies one decent laugh in the film and the sad thing is you can tell he is trying so hard to make this material funny, but it just isn't. Also, his character is meant to have a crush on Jessica Alba's character, but there is no chemistry between the two. I would blame the writers for Myers poor material to work with, but Myers co wrote it meaning I can not stick up for him. In the whole film I raised a smile once which is why I am not giving this film a 1 out of 10 as a scene involving Vearn Troyer pretending to have a heart attack made me laugh for a few seconds. On the whole it is a rubbish comedy supplying maybe one funny scene, which is disappointing for comedy film fans, but more for Myers fans. I doubt there will be a sequel as this has stained Myers record of funny comedies. Myers carer is in jeopardy and he must give us a new character who is funny and give us a funny film or he will always be known as the voice of Shrek and we all know he is better then that.

It's not surprising to see all the negative comments made here as my girlfriend thinks this badly of this movie as well. While yes, I will say that Mike Myers does recycle his jokes a little from other movies he's done, but you need a sense of humor. I am not easily amused but I see a movie for any good qualities and am not a harsh critic trying to destroy it. He has a lot of good inspirational mantras that while may or may not be in real philosophical texts, are true just the same - Drama - distraction, r-something, a-something, maturity, action...and Nowhere = Now here and a few others that I was actually trying to find in the quotes when I came across this and decided to add my own response. I laughed quite a bit during the movie and while before the movie said I felt bad that Jessica Alba was put into such a bad role, now felt that she wasn't put that badly...it could have been worse..she could have been put into a movie with Britney Spears or like into "Mean Girls". Either way, I thought this movie was pretty good!

When I saw the advertisements for this movie I wasn't very sure if I was going to enjoy it or not, and unfortunately after watching the movie I am back at point A. This movie could have been very good, but the constant sexual jokes, really just plain weird scenes made it very hard for me to like this movie. Granted there were some very funny part to this movie which made me and my friends laugh hard, but then there were parts to this movie that made us cringe at its stupidity and nastiness. I'm normally a fan of Mike Myers and I will not judge him off of this movie because every actor/actress makes one bad choice or two and I'm hoping this is one of his only. This movie really made me laugh then it made me think of how stupid it was and I just can't decide what side I'm on.

reviews.review_title: Great Move for all Mike Myer Fans!
reviews.content: I love the comic Wit of Mike Myers. I am also a Benny Hill Fan. Yes some of the humor may be crude but let loose and laugh! It is a great wild ride for the whole family. My Wife, 14 year old Son, 12 year old Daugther and myself loved this movie and all Austin Power flicks.This movie is not disrespectful to any religion. The whole film is a laugh trip from beginning to end. The comic version of 9 to 5 and other songs are also great! In a time where simple laughter seems to elude most Mr. Mike Myers still has it! Yea Baby! Keep it coming! Give the movie a chance. Go to see it with the idea of having a laugh and enjoying it. This is what this movie is for.

I am amazed at all the negative reviews. We saw this movie at the "dollar theater". I certainly got more than a dollars worth of laughs from this movie. I totally enjoyed it. Yes the humor was rather "boys locker room", but I thought it was a hoot. Maybe it's because I grew up with the Beatles and the Maharishi. It's a spoof guys. Lighten up!! I think of Ben Kingsley as a serious actor and seeing him in such a silly role was refreshing. Some of us ladies think Mike was adorable as the Love Guru. As a John Oliver and Steven Colbert fan, I loved seeing them in their roles in this movie. I'm sure Verne Troyer is laughing all the way to the bank. It didn't hurt a bit to watch this movie.

reviews.review_title: Watch jessica alba like never before...!
reviews.content: The movie is a story of an American taking up to be a guru,and mike myers has managed well with the accent and style. The costumes were good,and the sets were also nice. BUT THE ENTIRE PHILOSOPHY OR STORY OF THE MOVIE IS CRAPPINESS @ its best! The movie's genre is comedy and the only ones who get the laughs r characters inside the movie,they laugh for whatever mike myers says,and it looks pathetic! Jessica looks great in the Indian dress and some sound tracks made using sitar(Indian music instrument) was also OK. JESSICA ALBA LOOKS MIND BLOWINGLY GREAT in this movie and i wont hesitate to watch it again just for her,period. Don't waste your time on this,life's got lots to enjoy!cheers!

reviews.review_title: The Love Guru  An Alright Bad Film
reviews.content: The Love Guru, directed by Marco Schnabel and co-written by and starring Mike Myers, is really just a bad movie that is good. I suppose that's like saying that a common cold is the best illness to have or that Scary Spice is the best Spice Girl because at the end of the day it's still a bad experience and something to forget.Despite all the bad, make that very bad or even extremely bad, reviews for The Love Guru it's not as horrible as some people might think. For example, it's definitely better than Batman and Robin, Daddy Day Camp and Epic Movie (perhaps all put together) but worse than Semi-Pro, Jumper and You Don't Mess with the Zohan. And it is definitely worse than Austin Powers and Wayne's World by a long shot. The film does ask you the question throughout: should I be laughing with or at the jokes. The film certainly doesn't take itself seriously although at times some characters become thoughtful and for lack of a better word open up. Sometimes you don't know what you're doing, mainly what you're doing in the theater, but in the end you realize that it could be worse, much worse.The plot centers around an American-Indian guru named Pitka (Mike Myers), the author of many self-help books and seminars, who dreams of making it big in America primarily through appearing on The Oprah Winfrey Show. He gets his chance when the Toronto Maple Leafs ice hockey team owner Jane Bullard (Jessica Alba) and the team's coach (Verne Troyer) seek Pitka's help in curing the team's star love-sick player Darren Roanoke (Romany Malco). Roanoke's wife Prudence (Meagan Good) has recently left him for LA Kings goalkeeper Jacques Grande (Justin Timberlake) who's "talents" are not limited to the ice rink. Pitka, aided by his Indian colleague Rajneesh (Manu Narayan), sees this as his one chance to hit the big time and appear on Oprah and ultimately emulate his idol Deepak Chopra.Although on paper the plot seems quite involved and thought-out it's really just another failure in a long list. It's almost as if the film is merely a side project for all involved, something they shot on weekends, and that they have bigger and better things to do. Or is it that they are simply untalent and incapable in the first place. Verne Troyer is no Warwick Davis or Peter Dinklage and his role seems almost distasteful and offensive to his size. Jessica Alba again proves that although she might be a pretty face she cannot even delivery the most simplest of expression or emotion. The Love Guru adds yet another in a line of poor performances from her and sits soundly next to the likes of Fantastic Four, Good Luck Chuck, Honey and The Eye. It seems her only one good role to date was in Sin City, mainly because that film was directed by a credible and talented director in Robert Rodriquez. It really shows that good performances are usually in half due to the director guiding them. That's probably one of the reasons this film falls flat. Marco Schnabel has never directed a feature length movie and after this you'll wish he'd go back to school. After seeing The Love Guru you could say that one of the reasons Austin Powers was so good was because of its director Jay Roach, as it definitely takes more than a funny script to make a funny film. Some reviews have suggested that Justin Timberlake saves this film but my opinion is the opposite  he makes it worse. His comedic timing is terrible as is his accent. His Celine Dion-loving character is meant to be from Quebec (French-Canadian) but I'm not quite sure what he was trying to pull off  it was like a bad Borat impersonation that only your friends laugh at. That you can only asked yourself why one Sir Ben Kingsley, Knight of the Realm and more importantly Leading Actor Academy Award-winner is doing in this. I can only presume that perhaps he just felt like having a bit of fun. Also to mention, Rajneesh becomes incredibly annoying as Pitka's side-kick to such an extent that you feel like praying to the Devil himself that he be strike down. The supporting cast is quite good, mainly because they simply haven't got the screen time to affect them. These include Stephen Colbert and Jim Gaffigan, John Oliver, and Romany Malco does a better than expected job making him one of the few unhurt from the cast.In all the blame has to go to Mike Myers. He clearly a victim of his own success from the likes of Austin Powers and even Shrek as he probably believes that anything he touches will turn to box office and critical gold. The genitalia jokes in this film are endless so much so that it was almost like Myers' was dared by a friend to make a comedy made up entirely of crotch orientated gags. I knew from nearly every review I had read prior to seeing this film that it was full of them but never knew the extent until viewing it for myself. I found one part as a perfect example, although quite early on in the movie it sums up the entire 90mins. When John Oliver's character walks into the room to meet Pitka, Rajneesh announces that Richard Pants as arrived to which Pitka responds "Ah yes, Dick Pants". Myers' constant references to his home country and his favorite hockey team (which leads him to appearing as himself) tend to get over-cooked as well.In all there are almost endless new release films to choose from, both at the cinemas and on DVD, so The Love Guru should really be at the bottom of many people's list. This film will leave some disappointed and some really, maybe even extremely, disappointed. But note the key word that remains there: disappointed.

reviews.review_title: Why is this movie so underrated?
reviews.content: It is possibly Meyer's best. I am very surprised at the huge negative reaction to this film. It is the usual silly low-brow fun from Mike Meyers and anyone who appreciates his other films ought to find a lot to love in this one.Totally baffled at the public reaction to this one. Unless it is the publicized objections of the Hindu community, but honestly, I didn't make any connection to them when watching it. It reminds me more of a kooky new age cult than any specific religion. But even so, every other religion and ethnicity has been subject to comedic parody of one sort of another. All is fair in love, war and comedy.We have it on DVD and have watched it dozens of times and still love it every time. I hope there will be a sequel.Some day people will come around to appreciate it's genius, that's all I can say.

Well, um.it's not as bad as it looks. But let's face it, it looks awful.Myers portrays Guru Pitka, an American-born/Indian-raised new-age spiritualist. He strives to be the next Deepak Chopra. Chopra is his childhood friend and both Chopra and Pitka study under the same guru. In an early scene, Myers plays Pitka as a 12-year old in what has to be the creepiest usage of CGI since John Wayne was posthumously forced to shill for Coors. (But it could have been worseit could have been Coors Light.) Pitka is hired by the Toronto Maple Leafs' owner Jane Bullard (played by Jessica Alba) to help their lovelorn star player Darren Roanoke (played by Romany Malco) get his game face back so they can win the Stanley Cup. The rest of the movie exists primarily for Myers to riff on New Age platitudes and make dirty jokes.Myers take on the Eastern-based philosophy is an interesting conundrum. He seems to simultaneously be making fun of it AND have a fondness/belief in it. The movie is a tad schizophrenic in this regard. It can be hard to tell whether Myers thinks this is all rubbish or if he has a deep abiding belief in material of this sort. Seeing as how the real Deepak Chopra makes a cameo in the film, I tend to think it's the latter. But if that's the case, the jokes undermining the philosophy seem out of place. And some of the jokes are actually quite biting. For instance, there is a running gag where Pitka has "profound" statements that spell out acronyms, all of which are quickly followed by a "TM" trademark. Surely Jesus, Allah and/or Buddah never trademarked their beliefs to ensure they profited from the spread of their message. So the implication in the joke is that Pitka (and his ilk) is/are hucksters. But that is certainly not the overriding message of the film. While his character is seeking the fame of an Oprah appearance, with the exception of a brief lapse of judgment in the third act, he seems to have a very real concern for the outcome of the people he helps. And even that "lapse of judgment" consists of him taking a shortcut when helping someone, not him being malicious or underhanded.I imagine that this must be what it's like for people to watch "Night At The Roxbury" or "The Ladies Man" if they had never seen an episode of "Saturday Night Live". Mike Myers clearly spent a lot of time and effort developing this character. So much so that the jokes often feel like they are referencing things that we're already supposed to be fond of. And while it isn't the fiasco that the trailers make it look like, the best it can seem to muster is to be mildly amusing. The jokes can get so juvenile that when you do laugh, it's almost in spite of yourself. If it's a guilty pleasure, it's more "guilty" than "pleasure".As for the supporting cast, Jessica Alba has virtually nothing to do in this movie except gaze lovingly at Myers. But, unless she's never seen any of his other films, this couldn't have been a shock. And to add insult to injury, Myers character has taken a vow of chastity so she can barely even achieve the level of "love interest" status. Romany Malco does a fine job but is essentially the straight man. He's there to set-up Myers and, of course, gaze lovingly at himin a "manly" way of course. Verne Troyer, of Mini-Me fame, plays the Maple Leafs' coach. And, while I'm sure he's happy to have the work, he seems to exist solely for Myers/Pitka to make "midget" jokes. Of course, that's got to be better than another a season of the "Surreal Life"but not by much. On the upside, at no point in the film does Troyer have to gaze lovingly at Myers.If there's anything movies like "Superbad" and "Knocked Up" have taught us, it's that a movie can be raunchy and still be smart.
